data.title: Info Box Hide & Show Over And Over Again
data.body:
When I want to move order node list. Info box is hide & show over and over again. Here the screenshot that I mean:
![godot-hover-menu-box](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2444537/9705587/70cde8ea-54f3-11e5-8d9f-0666bcb06c95.jpg)

What I mean 'Info Box' is text in the box 'Reparent Selected Node(s)'. It hide & show when I hover on it.

data.title: Kinematic on Kinematic - remove applied force
data.body: There should be an option when KinematicBody2D colliding another KinematicBody2D, there shouldn't be any force applied(aka no collision movement).

data.title: Ignore some extension of files created by Visual Studio 2013
Remove trailing spaces from GDScript empty lines
data.body: Trailing spaces and tabs, specially in empty lines, kind of mess up the source code management. It think there should be an option to remove them. It seems that the `Auto Indent` option does it, but not from empty lines.

data.title: Broken 3D joints when exported.
data.body:
The gif on top was run inside the editor, and the gif on bottom is when exported.

I have no real way to  test, because no errors are thrown for these different behaviors, something to note, is that very rarely, even running from the editor this happens, but every time I test the exported version this happens.

![sumo_bug1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1546044/9701604/d97e3110-53e5-11e5-8394-3be987cbec17.gif)
![sumo_bug2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1546044/9701605/dcc3865e-53e5-11e5-9218-c15359ab6ad1.gif)

data.title: Dialogs not visible by default
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Seen in the master branch / 2.0 alpha

What happened with all dialogs (WindowDialog, ConfirmationDialog, etc)? they're all invisible when you run.

data.title: Convert To TileSet not respecting vframes/hframes
data.body:
I am creating a tileset like described in the tutorial (and editable scene I convert using Convert To -> TileSet) - with the variation that I do not have tiles in separate files, but in one atlas that I just load as a normal texture, but setting Vframes/Hframes and then just incrementing Frame for each tile. This is a really nice workflow.

However - when I try to use the tileset in a TileMap, I can see that the generated tileset have the entire texture as graphics for each tile, not respecting the Vframes/HFrames and Frame properties I set in the editable tileset.

data.title: Some api to be able to go to sleep for mobile device.
data.body:
Godot forces always on for mobile device.
But some api to be able to go to sleep for mobile device would be great.

data.title: fix game window runs only 800x600. fix #2426
data.body: this fix issue #2426

data.title: Game runs only 800x600 when play project on editor tool bar.
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Seen on master branch / 2.0 alpha

I changed width, height, test_width, test_height.
But It runs only 800x600 window size no matter what size in project settings.

data.title: at the opening of 15 or more scenes
data.body: at the opening of 15 or more scenes, part of the editor is hidden outside the screen

data.title: crashed: close editor
data.body:
when you close the editor or the transition to the list of projects is a constant crash. infuriates!
p:win

data.title: Progressive JPEG loading does not work
data.body: In Gimp on Linux, when 'progressive' is checked (default value) in the export dialog's advanced options, `load("..jpg")` returns a null object.

data.title: Allow exporting of 64 bit version without needing 32 bit template installed
data.body: Fixes: #1404

data.title: AcceptDialog in inspector does not expose "text" property
data.body: The AcceptDialog in the inspector does not expose the "text" property to be set.  The "title" is available to be set, however, the "text" has to be set manually via a GDScript command.

data.title: Download page of website is down
data.body:
The http://www.godotengine.org/wp/download page displays:
Binary Downloads
Warning: file_get_contents(http://151.236.22.217/build.html) [function.file-get-contents]: failed to open stream: Connection timed out in /home/okamstudio/godotengine.org/wp/wp-content/plugins/insert-php/insert_php.php(48) : eval()d code on line 3

data.title: Ripples and outside setting.
data.body:
Do not operate the settings "test_width", "test_height" in the project. At the start of the editor always starts in the resolution of "800x600"
When Scaling picture windows greatly dazzled.

data.title: crashed: duplication of animation
data.body: If you try to duplicate the animation occurs crashed

data.title: Optimizing Godot for the Web
data.body:
Hi! I saw

http://www.godotengine.org/wp/webassembly-godot-on-the-web/

which mentions asm.js issues. I'm one of the emscripten devs, and I'd like to help if you're interested.

Specifically I saw problems with Chrome and IE/Edge mentioned. Edge's latest prerelease version has asm.js optimizations enabled by default, and also has excellent WebGL perf, so I hope that Microsoft is no longer a problem, leaving only Chrome.

We should be able to run Godot well even on Chrome. What were the specific problems you encountered?

A common issue recently have been memory limitations on Chrome. I've been doing memory optimization work specifically for that, with some significant improvements (half the memory at peak in my tests), and I could help test that on Godot, if you want.

data.title: can_move_to seems not working
data.body:
I'm trying to check if a kinetic body can move to a determined position, can_move_to() should be the perfect choice for doing this but it seems not working properly.
I've made a test case for illustrating that. You can download from this location: 
http://www.officinepixel.com/download/godot/testcase_can_move_to.zip
when you run it you see KinematicBody trying to travel to Position3D but there is a rigid body in the between, so, when it reach the obstacle it stops. Despite this can_move_to() always returns true.

data.title: Script editor "Save As.." menu option does not recognize ".gd" file extension
data.body:
![bug2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4741886/9638262/07762a92-51a6-11e5-87a5-8502fd674c6a.gif)

It wants to save the Node2D, i want to save the script.

data.title: Issue #2409 Fixes editor freeze
data.body: Fixes editor freezing up. See issue #2409

data.title: Zoom option for the tile selector when using tiny tiles
data.body: I use 12x12 tiles for my maps and they are really hard to distinguish on a retina display. Maybe a zoom option for the tilset tiles or something else...

data.title: interface to define custom graphics engine
data.body: is it possible to add an interface to define custom graphics engines?

data.title: Drag spinboxes error (set_amount: Index p_amount out of size (1024))
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Seen in the master branch / 2.0 alpha

Problem founded in Particle2D, amount and lifetime.
If I move the mouse quickly up, it does not reach the maximum value.
and I get this error when I do this.

ERROR: set_amount: Index p_amount out of size (1024).
At: scene/2d/particles_2d.cpp:700
but the value stop in 854 for example.

Another bug, all controls that has "Range" properties, for example ProgressBar, if you change the "Min" value with this feature, godot will crash.

data.title: Flipped sprites in scene don't export properly to tile-set
data.body:
I had a sprite which flips its texture horizontally. This sprite was in a scene I exported to a tile set. The exported tile set does not preserve the flipping.

I am working under Linux with the stable version and have files to reproduce the bug. Mail eric_moyer@yahoo.com and I'll send you a copy. (I'd attach it but github won't let me.)

data.title: godot is freezing
data.body:
godot is freezing, it's seems to freeze when i am typing a string as parameter in the modulate function (i don't even run the game)
Godot don't even consumes 5% of my cpu when using the script, but when freezes it's jumps to 25% and stays there.
If i kill godot the godot process hangs there (with 25%)

data.title: 3D MODE:: Frustum culling starts to glitch when far enough from scene origin
data.body:
My specs.

---
- Win7 64bit
- 16GB RAM
- an ATI 7xxx GPU
- a third gen i7 CPU
# 

The images should explain everything, some objects become invisible depending on the camera angle and camera zoom (and it has nothing to do with the render settings in the project settings window or the clip values). The one thing that I know is quite consistent is that this never seems to be a problem if you have the camera pointed straight down or you have the camera looking out from near the center of the scene (coordinates being close to 0,0,0), but mainly if the camera starts going further from the origin and is looking at a shallower angle. I also notice that when I zoom, there seems to be a window where the objects are invisible, I can start with the objects being visible, then zoom out and see them go invisible and then visible again.
![godotbug1a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10081256/9569453/9fec5a8e-4f31-11e5-904e-78a071f35afd.jpg) ![godotbug1b](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10081256/9569456/a6e677de-4f31-11e5-98b9-85b0f9edbd8c.jpg)

I am treating this as a bug because I do not think this is intentional behavior that can simply be fixed with a setting change. I hope it can be fixed.

data.title: Exported game conflict with engine - windows
data.body:
1. Export the game in the same folder as the "godotengine.exe" is saved.
2. Start "godotengine.exe" and your exported game will start.
